definition: (physics) magnetic reconnection/(railways) double heading (using two locomotives at the front of a train)
to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet

sentences.english: The collisionless magnetic reconnection is studied using two dimensional full particle simulation.
sentences.chinese: 采用二维全粒子模拟方法研究了无碰撞磁场重联。

sentences.english: Cluster survey of cusp reconnection and its IMF dependence.
sentences.chinese: 尖点重联的聚类调查及其IMF信赖。

sentences.english: Magnetic reconnection is often triggered by the tearing mode instability.
sentences.chinese: 磁场重联常常会被撕裂模不稳定性触发。

sentences.english: Why should I pay for the reconnection fees?
sentences.chinese: 我为什么要支付重联的费用？

definition: power car/multiple-unit train (abbr. for 動車組|动车组)
(of trains etc) to set off (on a journey)/to start (being issued or circulated)/to start (happening)/originating
train or coach service ("service" as in "they run 12 services per day between the two cities")
grade/class number (in school)/flight or run number/flight or run (seen as an item)/shift (work period)
